contextId.information: This is an expression to give advice. "Putting on armor" is metonymy for getting prepared for battle. "Tell Ben Hadad, 'Do not boast as if you have already won a battle that you have not yet fought.'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_proverbs]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Tell Ben Hadad, 'No one who is just putting on his armor ... as if he were taking it off.'
